metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5443 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A non-privileged user or program can put code and a config file in a known non-privileged path (under C:/usr/local/) that will make curl <= 7.65.1 automatically run the code (as an openssl "engine") on invocation. If that curl is invoked by a privileged user it can do anything it wants.

notes.Note: alexmurray> This only affects the official curl builds for Windows

criterions.comment: curl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
